reviews.text: Just west of Bryce Canyon National Park, Cannonville is one of those small towns you would usually drive through en route to, well, just about anywhere else. But we stayed there - in a very basic, clean, oddly-designed hotel with exterior stairs (possibly "grand"?).
reviews.title: Adjacent to Bryce Canyon's spectacular sunrises...

reviews.text: Other reviews have said that they don't always answer the phone at the hotel - it's true, we did have one or two times where we had to call back - but for the most part it was no problem. And once you get there you see that it's truely a one-man operation - no hotel switchboard here!
reviews.title: Basic but Clean and Quiet

likes.disliked: — no Internet. Six miles to the nearest restaurants.

reviews.title: Great, comfortable place
reviews.text: As for extras - while there was a basketball hoop in the parking lot, there was no basketball - the owner's kids had taken it home.

reviews.title: unable to make a reservation
reviews.text: Other than that - it was your typical travelers motel - 2 queen beds, a bathroom, a parking space... what more do you need when you're waking up at 4:30 AM to view the sun rising over Bryce Canyon's craggy landscape?
